channel.title: Guardian Unlimited
channel.description: Intelligent news and comment throughout the day from The Guardian newspaper

image.title: Guardian Unlimited
image.description: Intelligent news and comment throughout the day from The Guardian newspaper

item.title: This RSS feed will shortly be removed
item.description: Guardian Unlimited now provides a wider range of RSS feeds, including a new version of this feed. Further information is available at http://www.guardian.co.uk/webfeeds/ . This feed (the one you are currently reading) will stop being updated in a few weeks, so we encourage all RSS subscribers to switch to the new feed(s) as soon as possible.

item.title: School bill passes with less rebels
item.description: Controversial education bill easily passes its third reading in the Commons tonight but Tony Blair is again forced to rely on opposition support after 46 Labour backbencher's rebelled.

item.title: Olmert: Israeli patience is limited
item.description: Israel wants to work with Palestinians to seek peace but won't wait forever, PM tells US Congress.

item.title: Islamic charity target of anti-terror raids
item.description: UK: Police sources say raids linked to alleged support for terrorist activities in Iraq.

item.title: Lords back £5m divorce payout
item.description: Law: 'Harvey Nichols wife' entitled to £5m after break-up of three-year marriage to City fund manager.

item.title: Aziz testifies at Saddam trial
item.description: World: Pyjama-clad former Iraqi foreign minister makes his first public appearance in three years.

item.title: Three injured in Istanbul airport fire
item.description: Turkey: Blaze sends smoke and flames 30 metres into the sky.

item.title: Reid apologises over wrong foreign prisoner figures
item.description: Politics: Home secretary apologises after figures he gave to MPs yesterday proved to be wrong.

item.title: Iran nuclear talks continue
item.description: Iran: Officials from EU, US, China and Russia meet in London to attempt to resolve Iran nuclear programme crisis.

item.title: New MPC member 'openminded' on rates
item.description: Business: Newest member of Bank's policy-making body is surprised at minimal impact of oil prices on inflation.

item.title: Wigan agree £8.5m Johnson fee
item.description: Football: Crystal Palace accept bid for Andy Johnson, but keep door open for Everton and Bolton to match offer.

item.title: 'Unhappy' Shahbaz leaves Big Brother house
item.description: Media: Big Brother contestant who threatened to kill himself on air has left the house.

item.title: Super-casino shortlist unveiled
item.description: Gambling: Four cities in the running to host Britain's first Las Vegas-style super-casino.

item.title: Herceptin 'to get UK licence'
item.description: Society: Breast cancer drug to get UK licence for use in early stages of disease, manufacturer Roche says.

item.title: Tories attack pensions reforms
item.description: Money: Workers will pay thousands each year for benefit that will be abolished under reforms, Conservatives claim.

item.title: Carberry sentenced to two-month jail term
item.description: Horse racing: A prank on a plane will cost leading National Hunt jockey two months in prison unless he wins appeal.
